entry.title: SAP TM Freight Agreement Approval Workflow Process and Set Up.
entry.content:
Understanding Freight Agreement Approval

Freight agreement approval workflow is an organized process used to manage the review and authorization of freight contracts within a company. It usually includes collaboration between various departments such as procurement, legal, finance and logistics. The goal is to ensure that every part of the agreement complies with internal policies and meets all legal and regulatory standards.

Key Components of an Effective Freight Agreement Approval Workflow

  • Centralized storage for all freight agreements with easy access.
  • Automatic routing to relevant stakeholders based on set criteria.
  • Role-based access control to ensure proper review and approval
  • Real-time tracking and audit trails for full transparency.

Business Benefits of a Freight Agreement Workflow

  • Faster approvals with automated workflows and defined processes.
  • Better cost control by spotting rate issues and managing freight spend.
  • Improved compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
  • Greater transparency and accountability with full audit tracking.
  • Stronger carrier partnerships through consistent agreement handling.

Freight Agreement Approval Workflow ‚Äì Configuration Steps 

  1. Org Level Configuration 
  2. Workflow Configuration 
  3. Freight Agreement Type Configuration 

1. Org Level Configuration 

  • All previously created organizational units are visible in the transaction code PPOME. 
  • Go to the organization unit, select your purchasing organization, and click Create. 
  • User IDs for the users who approve the freight agreement should be created in the backend. 
  • Create a position as Freight Agreement Approver. 
  • Select the Freight Agreement Approver option and click on Assign, then assign the user ID. 
  • Select the checkbox Head of Own Organizational Unit.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

WF_APPROVER is the USER which will approve the Freight agreement.

 

 

2.Workflow Configuration 

Perform following steps to trigger a workflow for Agreement 

1.Goto transaction SWDD‚ÄØ 
2.Go to Workflow -> Other workflow/version ‚Äì then enter task WS71100

 

 

 

 

3.Go to Go To->Basic Data.

 

 

Again, Go To->Agent Assignment for task‚ÄØ

 

Click on Attributes and select General Task

 

 

Then click on Update Index icon to generate the index.‚ÄØ

 

Return to the previous screen by pressing F3 twice.‚ÄØ

4. Now click on the second step of this workflow.  

 

Go to Decision tab->Agents, select Organization unit and enter the Purchasing organization. So that it allows the users assigned to this purchasing organization to approve/reject the workflow.

 

Go to Control tab->Agent Assignment‚ÄØ 

 

 

 

     

Click on Update Index to generate index. 

 

 

 

Return to the previous screen by pressing F3 twice.‚ÄØ                                                           

5. Mark BUSINESS OBJECT as import parameter on Workflow container. Applicable from S4 CORE 106 onwards.‚ÄØ 

Select Workflow Container from the left side of the screen

 

 

Then select BUSINESSOBJECT from Element, and then set Import check box under Properties tab.‚ÄØ   

 

 

 

Then save and activate the workflow task.

 

 

Additional Tips:‚ÄØ

Make sure workflow RFC destination is created‚ÄØ

 

 

Workflow tasks status can be viewed on transaction SWI1‚ÄØ 

3.Freight Agreement Type Configuration 

Create a new freight agreement type for the freight agreement approval workflow. 
In the freight agreement type, select the Approval Workflow checkbox to enable workflow-based approval.

 

 

Test case 1: Confirm Approval Request 

Freight agreement approval notification: 
Go to the freight agreement and click on the Request Approval button to initiate the approval process. 

 

Once you click on Request for Approval, the lifecycle status of the freight agreement is updated to Awaiting Approval. 

 

 

 

An email notification will be sent to the respective users assigned to the purchasing organization.  

Check ‚ÄòMy Inbox‚Äô app or transaction SBWP to take action. 

 

 

Click on Confirm Approval Request ‚Äì the freight agreement lifecycle status will be updated to Released. 

 

 

Test Case2: Reject Approval Request 

If Approver wants to reject the freight agreement approval, click on the ‚ÄòReject Approval Check‚Äô.

 

 

If Approver wants to reject the freight agreement approval, click on the ‚ÄòReject Approval Check‚Äô.

 

The lifecycle status of the freight agreement is  ‚ÄòIn Process‚Äô. 

 

Note: if there are multi-level approval required that is also possible.

Conclusion

The Freight Agreement Approval Workflow plays a key role in controlling transportation costs and maintaining compliance with agreed terms. By automating the approval process, it reduces delays, minimizes errors, and improves transparency across departments. With features like tiered approvals, audit trails, and real-time notifications, it ensures that agreements are reviewed quickly and securely. Integrating this workflow into your logistics or SAPTM system strengthens supplier relationships and improves contract management. Ultimately, it helps teams make better decisions and aligns logistics operations with overall business goals.

entry.title: Re: Couldn't subscribe to Integration Suite. Try again. I...
entry.content:
I encountered a similar issue, and the following steps resolve it:
- Go to Subscriptions and delete the existing Integration Suite.
- Go to the Service Marketplace, locate Integration Suite, and click on the three dots ‚Üí Create, you might see an error message stating that no subscription exists, just ignore it. The subscription will be created automatically.

I don‚Äôt have a clear logical explanation for this behavior; it seems to be an internal BTP issue. However, these steps worked for me.

entry.title: Re: Double Periods (". . ") Not Throwing Syntax Error In...
entry.content:
Hello Rohan,

This is actually expected behavior in ABAP.

In ABAP, the period (.) is a statement terminator. When you write something like:

WRITE: 'SUCCESS'..

the compiler interprets it as:

WRITE: 'SUCCESS' . .

  • The first ( . ) terminates the WRITE statement.

  • The second ( . ) is treated as an empty statement, which is syntactically valid in ABAP and simply does nothing.

That‚Äôs why the compiler does not throw a syntax error, and the program still activates and runs successfully.

The same logic applies when you add an extra period after ( ENDIF. ) or any other statement ‚Äî ABAP just considers it as an additional empty statement.

So, it‚Äôs not a bug or an error, but an intentional design of the ABAP syntax rules.

entry.title: Re: SAP Precalculation Server "ERROR: program BIPRECXY no...
entry.content:
Found the Solution. In TA "RSPRECALCADMIN" was no option to select an gateway-host. 

Needed to add this option via Note 1496606 - RSPRECALCADMIN: allow entry of gateway host - SAP for Me

  • Use transaction SE38 to add the following text element to report RS_PRECALC_ADMIN: 089 Gateway Host
  • Use transaction SE11 to change the Data Type RSR_PRECALC_ADMIN_SERVER. Add the Component GWHOST with Component Type RFCGWHOST.

We are using an SAPROUTER as proxy so i had to add saprouterstring to the gateway-host.

entry.content:
Hi @acmebcn ,

You only need the ROOT CA, which is at the top of the certificate chain.
When sending a message, you can check the response from the cloud in transaction /n/ASADEV/ACI_MONITOR.
In the response, you can see whether the message successfully reached SAP Event Mesh or, in case of an error (e.g., SSL certificate issues), why it failed.

Kind Regards,
Benedikt

entry.title: How to consume OData service in Fiori app using approuter and destination in Cloud Foundry (404 Not
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am developing a CAP project on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry. I want to consume an OData V4 service from a Fiori (UI5) application using approuter and a destination.

- Backend (CAP, OData V4):
https://<subdomain>-back.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/v4/invitacion/ReadProveedor

- Frontend (Fiori + approuter):
https://<subdomain>-frontend.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/frontfront/index.html

### Approuter (xs-app.json)
```json
{
"welcomeFile": "/frontfront/index.html",
"routes": [
{
"source": "^/backend/(.*)$",
"target": "/$1",
"destination": "SRV_BACKEND",
"authenticationType": "xsuaa"
}
]
}

 

 

Destination in BTP cockpit

  • Name: SRV_BACKEND
  • URL: https://-back.cfapps..hana.ondemand.com
  • ProxyType: Internet
  • Authentication: OAuth2JWTBearer

 

Frontend manifest.json

"dataSources": {
"backend_odata": {
"uri": "/backend/odata/v4/invitacion/",
"type": "OData",
"settings": { "odataVersion": "4.0" }
}
}

 

Problem

When the app tries to load metadata (/backend/odata/v4/invitacion/$metadata), I receive 404 Not Found.

Accessing the backend service directly via its URL works fine.

What I tried

  • Verified that the destination exists in BTP cockpit and points to the backend URL.
  • Checked the backend service directly (responds correctly).
  • Reviewed approuter logs ‚Äî I see messages like ‚ÄúMissing internal url for request ‚Ä¶‚Äù.

What configuration should I adjust in the approuter or the destination so that the frontend Fiori app can correctly consume the OData service via /backend/...?

Any guidance or working examples would be greatly appreciated

entry.title: Should I take Modvigil as soon as I wake up?
entry.content: It is normally advised to take Modvigil as soon as you wake up, particularly if you are using it to treat narcolepsy or excessive daytime drowsiness. Early use lowers the chance of sleeplessness at night and increases alertness during the day. Take it with water and on an empty stomach for optimal effects. Modvigil should be taken around an hour prior to the start of your shift if you are taking it to treat shift work sleep disturbance. Because time might vary depending on your daily activity and particular ailment, always heed your doctor's advise.

entry.title: Re: Clarification on how ‚ÄúLinked Object‚Äù is populated for...
entry.content:
Hi @ludgero_vasconcelos 

In our understanding and according to our experience the OCNLearningEvents API only allows you to send completion status on item level but not on content object level.

In our understanding OCN completions only work fine if you have a 1:1 relationship between an LMS item and an OCN Course of your OCN Content Provider. 

To compare: With Scorm 1.2 you can complete a single content object within an item. So an item can have several content objects that have to be completed one by one before the whole item ist marked as completed. But this logic doesn't exist in OCN context. OCN always completes the whole item.

KR Jonas
